eligibleReasons.reason: Disability diagnosis may qualify for SSI
High income may reduce SSI benefit amount

nextSteps: Apply through Social Security Administration at ssa.gov or call 1-800-772-1213

eligibleReasons.reason: Disability diagnosis may qualify for SSDI (requires work history)

nextSteps: Apply through Social Security Administration at ssa.gov or call 1-800-772-1213
Contact your state's SNAP office or apply at your local Department of Social Services

benefitInteractions.description: SSI and SSDI are different programs. You may qualify for one or both depending on work history and income.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for both programs. They serve different purposes and can stack.

benefitInteractions.description: SSI income counts toward SNAP eligibility. You may still qualify for SNAP.
benefitInteractions.recommendation: Apply for SNAP even if you receive SSI. Your SSI income will be counted, but you may still qualify.

actionPlanOrder.step: Apply for SSI (Supplemental Security Income) through the Social Security Administration at ssa.gov or call 1-800-772-1213.
actionPlanOrder.combinedStep: Apply for both SSI and SSDI through Social Security at ssa.gov or call 1-800-772-1213. They are different programs and you may qualify for both.

actionPlanOrder.step: Apply for SSDI (Social Security Disability Insurance) through the Social Security Administration. After 24 months, you will automatically get Medicare.
Apply for SNAP (food assistance) through your state's social services office.
